intro: Hariota monacantha, commonly known as the African violet, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the Gesneriaceae family and is characterized by its thick, fleshy leaves and showy, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows as a herbaceous perennial, often forming compact rosettes. Its flowers come in a variety of colors, including purple, pink, and white, and are pollinated by insects. Hariota monacantha is popular as a houseplant due to its ornamental value and relatively easy care requirements.
